summary: S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite have returned to record territory for the first time in months . Investors wonder whether the new records signal the start of a longer-lasting rally in the U.S. stock market .  Technology stocks have been at the forefront of the market’s record-setting rally . The Magnificent Seven cohort of megacap tech names have collectively added $4.7 trillion in market capitalization since April 8 .  S&P 500’s information-technology sector XX:SP500.45 has popped over 41% since early April . The communication-services sector is up nearly 28%, compared with the 24% gain for the broader index . Microchip Technology Inc. MCHP also logged notable gains of over 100% in the same period .  The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite COMP briefly tested their record highs for the first time in at least four months . Strong returns in cyclical sectors since April 8 suggest the record-setting rally isn’t entirely confined to megacap technology stocks . However, the NYSE A/D line shows positive breadth in the stock rally .  Only about 50% of the S&P 500’s stocks on Thursday traded above their 200-day moving averages . That's well below the early-May highs, according to data compiled by Sevens Report Research . A healthy market sees between 65% and 80% of stocks trading above their DMA .  The S&P 500 Equal Weight Index XX:SP500EW has risen 18.7% since April 8 . That compares with the 24% advance for the market-cap-weighted index in the same period . Investors have been growing more confident in the outlook for the U.S. economy ever since President Obama took office .  U.S. stocks finished higher on Friday, with the three major stock indexes booking strong weekly gains . The S&P 500 rose 3.4% for the week, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA was up 3.8% and the Nasdaq Composite surged 4.3% . The likelihood of at least three quarter-point rate cuts from the Fed by year-end lifted market sentiment .  20 banks are expected to increase their dividends the most following the Fed’s stress tests . 20 banks were tested for their ability to pass the stress tests in the wake of the stress test .

Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) has lost 14.6% year-to-date . Cramer believes that the firm is a technology and robotics company . The CNBC host has been left mostly unbothered by the stock price performance .  Cramer commented on Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA)’s robotaxi launch: While we acknowledge the potential of TSLA as an investment, our conviction lies in the belief that some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and have limited downside risk .

The S&P 500 has rallied more than 25% off its April low . The week brings a packed economic calendar culminating with Friday's jobs report . The market will close early Thursday for Independence Day celebrations .  Manufacturing has faced headwinds throughout 2025, with several months showing contraction territory below the critical 50 level . Any signs of expansion could boost cyclical sectors and industrial stocks . The ISM Manufacturing PMI report typically carries more market weight due to its broader survey base .  The ISM Manufacturing Prices component will be particularly scrutinized for inflation signals . Companies in the materials, industrials, and machinery sectors could see heightened volatility based on these readings . Continued weakness might raise concerns about broader economic resilience heading into the second half of the year .  Fed Chair Jerome Powell's scheduled speech at 9:30am Tuesday represents the week's most significant monetary policy event . Powell's remarks will be closely analyzed for any evolution in the Fed's thinking about the timing and pace of potential rate adjustments .  Friday's jobs report at 8:30am represents the week's most consequential data release . The employment picture has remained robust throughout 2025, supporting consumer spending and economic growth . Any significant deviation from recent strength could alter expectations .  The convergence of JOLTS job openings data Tuesday, ADP Wednesday, and the comprehensive jobs report Friday creates potential for sustained volatility in employment-sensitive sectors . Average hourly earnings data will be particularly scrutinized as a key inflation indicator .  Traders should prepare for potentially wider spreads and more volatile price action, particularly around Wednesday's data releases and Friday morning's jobs report . The holiday timing may also influence institutional positioning decisions and options expirations .

TD Cowen reaffirmed its Buy rating and $330 price target for Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) The electric car manufacturer’s eagerly awaited robotaxi service was launched in Austin on June 22 . The first day of operations saw no significant safety or vehicle performance difficulties .  Tesla is a well-known clean energy company that is best known for its electric vehicles . In addition to designing, producing, and marketing EVs, Tesla also offers solar panels, solar shingles, and energy storage devices . While we acknowledge potential of TSLA as an investment, we believe certain AI stocks offer greater upside potential and carry less downside risk .

Tesla's autonomous vehicles finally hit the streets of Austin, Texas, this month . The initial rollout has been bumpy, with several viral videos highlighting safety concerns . Is Tesla about to catalyze a $10 trillion global robotaxi market? Or is the launch simply a game of smoke and mirrors?  Analysts think 90% of Tesla's market cap will eventually stem from its robotaxi division . The average stock price prediction from Wall Street calls for a share price of just $320 by the end of 2025 .  Ives has a $500 price target on Tesla -- among the highest of any analysts . He thinks that the robotaxi opportunity alone could add $1 trillion to Tesla's market cap by the end of 2026 . Other companies includingUber,Amazon's Zoox, and Alphabet's Waymo have been investing in this space for years .  A rapid reduction in costs, combined with rapid innovation around artificial intelligence, make that a near certainty . Still, robotaxis and self-driving vehicles as a whole will eventually become a large part of society . Who will win and how the industry will take shape is far from certain . In the past 15 years, this top EV stock has climbed more than 20,000%. Tesla shares have always sold for a premium, which is detached from the reality of the current business . Investors considering buying the stock must believe the company will make good on its plans for autonomous driving and robotics .  In the first quarter, Tesla reported $14 billion of automotive revenue, 72% of the total . Total revenue was up just 0.9% in 2024, then it declined 9.2% in Q1 2025 . Operating income in first quarter tanked 66%, thanks to lower average selling prices and fewer deliveries .  Based on the current market cap of $1 trillion and P/E ratio of 179, Tesla is wildly overvalued . The company has finally launched arobotaxi service in Austin, Texas . However, I think it turned out to be a big nothing burger .  The company is also working on a humanoid robot called Optimus . Musk believes it will produce 1 million units annually by the end of this decade . The end markets for robotaxis and humanoid robots are estimated to be measured in the trillions of dollars . President Trump's "Big Beautiful Bill" could derail that growth . Investors will want to carefully monitor the political risk factors . Today, more than 90% ofTesla's vehicle sales come from its two mass-market models .  Federal EV tax credits -- which can total up to $7,500 -- effectively lower the prices that consumers pay for those vehicles . President Donald Trump and Republicans in Congress are moving to eliminate those tax credits . Would Rivian be impacted? Germany, of all places, provides us with clues .  The Motley Fool Stock Advisor's total average return is 1,062% -- a market-crushing outperformance compared to177% for the S&P 500 . Germany's history is a strong testament to that possibility, so if you're invested in Rivian or any other EV stock, carefully monitor the political risk factors .  Tesla is one of the fastest growing companies in the world . The company recently announced its first electric car production . Tesla's electric car sales are expected to double in the next few years .

Tesla debuts its driverless car service in a limited public rollout in Austin, Texas . The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) hasopened an investigation into the service .  The robotaxi launch featured about 10 cars traveling in a limited area of Austin with safety drivers in the passenger seat . Rides, which the company offered to a host of handpicked influencers, cost $4.20, in keeping with Musk’s proclivity for cannabis memes .  Footage from at least 11 rides showed that the trial run did not pan out as flawlessly as Tesla’s tweet suggested . In one case, a robotaxi failed to make a left turn and instead drove into a lane meant for oncoming traffic . The videos drew the attention of the NHTSA, which said in a statement it was aware of the incidents .  Tesla’s consumer vehicles come with ‘autopilot’ and ‘full self-driving’ features that allow drivers to cruise on the highway hands-free . The reliance on cameras alone stands in sharp contrast with other autonomous vehicle companies such as Waymo .  Lidar and radar allow for self-driving cars to better detect objects in bad weather and poor lighting . “Lidar is lame,” Musk said during a Tesla autonomy day in 2019 . Musk maintains that camera-only technology is the most “human” way to approach self-driven .  Tesla did not respond to a request for comment on the lawsuits . Lawyer: Tesla has a fetishistic view that it’s going to operate its system solely on cameras, despite every intelligent human being in this space saying that can’t be done .  Waymo is seen widely as the frontrunner in the self-driving race in the US . The Google subsidiary has historically spent months, if not years, mapping cities and testing its vehicles in them before launching . In San Francisco, one of the first cities where Waymo launched its fully driverless commercial service, the company began mapping and testing in 2021 before launching it to the public in 2024 .  Waymo launched as a project under Google’s X research lab in 2009 . Earlier this year, more than 1,200 of its vehicles had to be recalled over a software issue that was causing collisions with chains and gates .  Tesla also did not have a permit to operate its robotaxi service in Austin, Texas . Uber was forced to shut down the service a week later after the DMV revoked its registration . Tesla also does not currently have a process to acquire a permit .  Tesla has been promising that Teslas will be fully self-driving since at least 2016 . The deadline has been deferred several times over the past 10 years .

The U.S. jobs report, scheduled for release on Thursday, leads several labor market reports set for release this week . Investors will also be watching Congress for passage of President Donald Trump’s “One Big, Beautiful Bill . Beer producer Constellation Brands (STZ) is a highlight of a limited corporate earnings calendar .  Thursday’s scheduled release of June jobs numbers comes as the labor market has remained resilient despite concerns of a hiring slowdown . Trump has put pressure on the Fed to cut rates, with some officials now open to the idea .  Investors will also be eyeing updates on Trump’s tariff policy ahead of a July 9 deadline to negotiate new deals with U.S. trading partners . Constellation Brands, the maker of Modelo and Corona beers, is scheduled to report earnings Tuesday . Tesla is expected to report June deliveries Wednesday .  U.S. manufacturing PMI (June), Construction spending (May), Job openings (May) Key Earnings: Constellation Brands, MSC Industrial Direct (MSM), Greenbrier (GBX) Wednesday, July 2 ADP employment (June) Tesla June deliveries data expected .

Rivian makes all-electric vehicles, specializing in SUVs and pickup trucks . The company has ramped up production and is now working on trimming costs . The next big step is offering a mass-market vehicle . Rivian stock could be a smart addition to your portfolio today .  Rivian is a tiny upstart trying to use a technological innovation to break into the auto business . The auto sector is already mature and highly competitive . Tesla has already built its business from the ground up, starting with high-end sports cars .  Rivian is now shifting its focus to streamlining the manufacturing process . The early goal was simply to get to the point where it turned a gross profit, which it achieved in late 2024 . Management knows there are more costs below the gross profit line that will likely keep Rivian's bottom line in the red .  Rivian isn't likely to be an attractive choice for risk-averse investors . It is still in the start-up phase, and execution will be vital . Rivian has been executing well, and its corporate partners have been pleased .  The Motley Fool Stock Advisoranalyst team just identified what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy now… and Rivian Automotive wasn’t one of them . More aggressive investors who believe Rivian will follow the Tesla business model might want to jump on Rivian stock now . Tesla could lose market share again in the quarter amid weakening sales . Confirmation of a lower-cost vehicle in production could boost the stock . Elon Musk's company typically releases its production and delivery data for the quarter shortly after the quarter ends .  Tesla likely to reveal data indicating that Tesla lost share in the electric vehicle (EV) market . Tesla sells directly to consumers, either online or through its stores . At the end of 2022, Tesla held 58% of the U.S. EV market, a figure that fell to 50.9% by 2023, then to 44.4% by 2024 .  The bears will argue that this is a consequence of a tired lineup of vehicles, amid concerns that Tesla is losing its competitive edge . The bulls will see it as an inevitable consequence of heavy investments by its competitors . Tesla investors may be willing to accept a decline in market share, but they won't want to see Tesla's automotive sales continue to decline .  Production of the Cybercab is due for volume production in 2026 . Lower-cost vehicles are an integral part of the case for robotaxis . Tesla needs to do this because it needs to lower unit costs of production .  Tesla's release of lower-cost models in 2025 could revitalize its lineup, start boosting sales, and capitalize on its position as a profitable EV maker with a cost structure that makes EVs more affordable to the mass public . Commercializing robotaxis will take time, and the Cybercab production ramp is understandably tied to that .  If you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009, you’d have $409,114! Tesla stock has declined 20% year to date amid disappointing financial results . The silver lining is that Tesla recently launched its first robotaxi service, which may generate hundreds of billions of dollars in revenue in the future .  Consensus earnings estimates among Wall Street analysts have been revised sharply lower in the last 90 days due to headwinds surrounding the core automotive business . Tesla's deliveries have declined in three of the last five quarters as demand for its aging lineup ofelectric cars has nosedived .  Wall Street now expects Tesla's adjusted earnings to increase at 14% annually through 2026 . That makes the current valuation of 145 times adjusted earnings look absurdly expensive .  Tesla's robotaxis hit the streets in Austin, Texas, on June 22, though rides are currently restricted to invitees . Autonomous ride-sharing promises to be a substantial opportunity for Tesla . RBC analyst Tom Narayan estimates that the company could earn $115 billion in robotaxi revenue in 2040 .  Jonas estimates that the company could earn $700 billion in robotaxi revenue in 2040, which he says could equate to about $120 billion in profits . Tesla could be much more profitable in the future .
